```{r}
#| label: setup
source("../_helpers/iceHelpers.R")
```

```{r}
#| label: data-prep
dat <- prepIceData(fn="../_data/IceDates.xlsx",sheet="Eagle")
sum <- sumIceData(dat) |>
  mutate(outEarlyYr=dat$fyr[which(dat$outDay==outEarlyDay)],
         outLateYr=dat$fyr[which(dat$outDay==outLateDay)])

tmp1 <- prepIceData(fn="../_data/IceDates.xlsx",sheet="Nebagamon")
tmp2 <- prepIceData(fn="../_data/IceDates.xlsx",sheet="Mendota")

dat2 <- bind_rows(dat,tmp1,tmp2) |>
  select(lake,season,fyr,outDate,outDay) |>
  mutate(lake=factor(lake,levels=c("Eagle","Nebagamon","Mendota")))
```

```{r}
#| label: EagleIce
#| out-width: 67%
knitr::include_graphics("Eagle_Ice.jpg")
```

:::{.callout-warning icon=false}
# Summary

- [Eagle Lake, in Bayfield County](https://dnr.wi.gov/lakes/lakepages/LakeDetail.aspx?wbic=2902900), is 163 acres with a maximum depth of 52 feet.
- Ice-out dates recorded from `r min(dat$fyr)` to `r max(dat$fyr)`.
- Average ice-out date is `r sum$outAvgDate`.
- Range of ice-out dates is approximately eight weeks from `r sum$outEarlyDate` (in `r sum$outEarlyYr`) to `r sum$outLateDate` (in `r sum$outLateYr`)  (see @fig-outhist).
- There are *weak* indications for a slightly later ice-out date in the last decade (see @fig-out).
- Ice-out dates were mostly similar to those from a nearby similarly-sized lake (see @fig-compare).
:::

&nbsp;

## Ice-Out Dates

```{r}
#| label: fig-outhist
#| fig-cap: !expr paste0("Eagle Lake ice out dates, 1999-",max(dat$fyr),".")
#| fig-width: 5
#| fig-height: 4

p_outhist <- ggplot(data=dat,mapping=aes(x=outDay)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth=5,boundary=0,fill=FSA::col2rgbt(outclr,0.5),color="black") +
  scale_y_continuous(expand=expansion(mult=c(0,0.02))) +
  scale_x_continuous(name="Day of Ice-Out",
                     breaks=date_breaks2,labels=date_labels2) +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_blank(),axis.text.y=element_blank(),
        panel.grid.major.y=element_blank(),panel.grid.minor.y=element_blank())

p_outhist +
  annotate(geom="text",hjust="right",color=outclr,
           x=92,y=3.5,label=paste0("Average (",sum$outAvgDate,")")) +
  annotate(geom="curve",x=92.5,y=3.5,xend=sum$outAvgDay,yend=0,
           linewidth=0.75,curvature=-0.1,color=outclr,
           arrow=arrow(length=unit(3,"mm"),angle=20,type="closed"))
```

&nbsp;

```{r}
#| label: fig-out
#| fig-cap: Eagle Lake ice out dates by year. Note no data for 1998.

p_out <- ggplot(data=dat,mapping=aes(x=fyr)) +
  geom_smooth(mapping=aes(y=outDay),se=FALSE,color=outclr) +
  geom_line(mapping=aes(y=outDay),linewidth=main_lw,color=main_clr) +
  geom_point(mapping=aes(y=outDay),size=1,shape=21,fill="white") +
  scale_y_continuous(expand=expansion(mult=0.08),
                     breaks=date_breaks2,labels=date_labels2) +
  scale_x_continuous(name="Season Starting Year",
                     breaks=yr_breaks5,
                     expand=expansion(mult=0.01)) +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor.y=element_blank())

p_out +
  annotate(geom="text",vjust=1.5,color=outclr,
           x=sum$outEarlyYr,y=sum$outEarlyDay,
           label=paste0("Earliest (",sum$outEarlyDate,")")) +
  annotate(geom="text",vjust=-0.5,color=outclr,
           x=sum$outLateYr,y=sum$outLateDay,
           label=paste0("Latest (",sum$outLateDate,")")) +
  annotate(geom="point",x=1998.5,y=sum$outAvgDay,
           shape="-",color=outclr,size=10) +
  annotate(geom="text",hjust="left",color=outclr,
           x=2002,y=90,label=paste0("Average Out (",sum$outAvgDate,")")) +
  annotate(geom="curve",x=2001.5,y=90,xend=1998.5,yend=sum$outAvgDay,
           linewidth=0.75,curvature=-0.3,color=outclr,
           arrow=arrow(length=unit(3,"mm"),angle=20,type="closed"))
```

&nbsp;

## Comparison to Other Lakes

[Lake Nebagamon](https://dnr.wi.gov/lakes/lakepages/LakeDetail.aspx?wbic=2865000) is much larger (986 acres) but with a similar maximum depth (56 ft) as Eagle Lake that is approximately 20 miles nearly straight west of Eagle Lake. With the exception of a few notable years, the ice-out dates between these two lakes are quite similar. [Lake Mendota](https://dnr.wi.gov/lakes/lakepages/LakeDetail.aspx?wbic=805400) is a very large (9781 acres) and deep (83 ft maximum) lake that is approximately 350 miles south of Eagle Lake. The ice-out dates for Mendota are always before those for Eagle Lake, but the very generally track together.

```{r}
#| label: fig-compare
#| fig-cap: Eagle Lake ice out dates by year with other lakes shown for comparison.

ggplot(data=dat2,mapping=aes(x=fyr,color=lake)) +
  geom_line(mapping=aes(y=outDay),linewidth=main_lw) +
  geom_point(mapping=aes(y=outDay),size=1,shape=21,fill="white") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks=date_breaks2,labels=date_labels2,
                     expand=expansion(mult=0.08)) +
  scale_x_continuous(name="Season Starting Year",
                     limits=c(1999,2022),
                     breaks=yr_breaks5,
                     expand=expansion(mult=0.01)) +
  theme(panel.grid.minor.y=element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        legend.position=c(0.1,0.90),
        legend.title=element_blank(),legend.text=element_text(size=10))
```
